messages.page_content:
- Topic: Roll Call and Quorum Establishment
- Summary: The roll call was conducted to establish the presence of council members, with five members present initially and two members arriving later, constituting a quorum.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Quorum established for the meeting
- Tags/Keywords: Roll call, quorum, council members
- UID: 52792fdb-cb3f-448c-a5ef-c01a2c5c3c84

- Topic: Grant Funds Allocation for Various Organizations
- Summary: The ordinance requested grant funds for several organizations, including Idea Village, New Orleans Business Alliance, Downtown Development District, Total Community Action, Inc., Arts Council of New Orleans, and Together New Orleans.
- Ordinance Number: R-22-515
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopt - (YEAS: Giarrusso, Green, Moreno, Morrell - 4, NAYS: 0, ABSTAIN: 0)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted, and the grant funds were allocated to the specified organizations.
- Tags/Keywords: Grant funds, organizations, allocation
- UID: 55246ee1-6deb-4ced-bbaf-143b0e50fbed

- Topic: Creation of City of New Orleans Home Rule Charter Review Committee
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the creation of an advisory committee, known as the City of New Orleans Home Rule Charter Review Committee, to review and make non-binding recommendations to the New Orleans City Council regarding potential changes to the Home Rule Charter.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-516
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was referred to the Governmental Affairs Committee and continued to the meeting of 12/15/22.
- UID: 65c22ad4-05b6-4366-966d-e23d1bf8aa87

- Topic: Mid-year report on NOPD recruitment and retention initiatives
- Summary: The ordinance directs the Chief Administrative Office (CAO), the NOPD, and the Civil Service Department to collaborate and develop a mid-year report on key recruitment and retention initiatives corresponding to the FY2023 budget allocation for the NOPD, to be transmitted to the City Council by June 1, 2023.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-518
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Motion to Suspend the Rules - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion to suspend the rules passed, and the ordinance was electronically submitted for further action.
- UID: 65c22ad4-05b6-4366-966d-e23d1bf8aa87

- Topic: Communication from Erin Spears - Chief of Staff & Counsel, Council Utilities Regulatory Office
- Summary: Erin Spears submitted communications related to electric and gas utility matters to be received by the Council of the City of New Orleans. The communications included memos, comments, and technical reference manuals from Entergy New Orleans, LLC, as well as a petition for intervention from the Alliance for Affordable Energy.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Suspend the Rules - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
    - Vote 2: Adopt - Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The Council received and accepted the communications related to electric and gas utility matters.
- Tags/Keywords: Erin Spears, Entergy New Orleans, electric utility, gas utility, communications, petition for intervention
- UID: 5c8a1cec-fc0f-4a52-8996-c47027c9d6d5

- Topic: Amendment to the Classified Pay Plan (Police Hiring Rate Increases)
- Summary: The Personnel Director of the City of New Orleans submitted an Amendment to the Classified Pay Plan for Police Hiring Rate Increases. The amendment was adopted by the Civil Service Commission and referred to the Budget Committee for Council approval.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Referred to Budget Committee
- Decision/Key Actions: Referred to Budget Committee for further consideration and approval.
- Tags/Keywords: Classified Pay Plan, Police Hiring Rate Increases, Civil Service Commission
- UID: b4243f16-6086-45f8-80de-6272994a9fc1

- Topic: Amendment to Classified Pay Plan (Police-Special Rate of Pay)
- Summary: Amy B. Trepagnier, Personnel Director, City of New Orleans, Department of Civil Service, submitted an amendment to the Classified Pay Plan for a new Special Rate of Pay for the police, in accordance with the Constitution of Louisiana. The amendment was referred to the Budget Committee.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Referred to the Budget Committee
- Tags/Keywords: Classified Pay Plan, Police, Budget Committee
- UID: 69580d9f-3f08-49b4-b693-763cd74ae08b

- Topic: Amendment to Classified Pay Plan (Police Recruitment and Retention Pay)
- Summary: Amy B. Trepagnier, Personnel Director, City of New Orleans, Department of Civil Service, submitted an amendment to the Classified Pay Plan for Police Recruitment and Retention Pay, in accordance with the Constitution of Louisiana. The amendment was referred to the Budget Committee.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Referred to the Budget Committee
- Tags/Keywords: Classified Pay Plan, Police Recruitment, Retention Pay, Budget Committee
- UID: 69580d9f-3f08-49b4-b693-763cd74ae08b

- Topic: Election Results from November 8, 2022, Proposition Elections
- Summary: Darren P. Lombard, Clerk of Court, submitted the election results from the November 8, 2022, proposition elections.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:

- Decision/Key Actions: Election results received
- Tags/Keywords: Election Results, Proposition Elections
- UID: 69580d9f-3f08-49b4-b693-763cd74ae08b

- Topic: Board of Liquidation, City Debt Resolution
- Summary: Tracy David Madison, Secretary, Board of Liquidation, City Debt, submitted a resolution recommending a millage levy of 19.5 mills to service the bonded debt of the City during the year 2023.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Resolution adopted, recommending millage levy
- Tags/Keywords: Board of Liquidation, City Debt, Millage Levy
- UID: 69580d9f-3f08-49b4-b693-763cd74ae08b

- Topic: Resolution Addressing Proposed Ordinance 33950
- Summary: The Ethics Review Board submitted a resolution addressing proposed ordinance 33950, which would give additional responsibilities to the Office of the Independent Police Monitor.
- Ordinance Number: 33950
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (Unanimous)
- Decision/Key Actions: The resolution addressing proposed ordinance 33950 was unanimously passed.
- Tags/Keywords: Ethics Review Board, Office of the Independent Police Monitor, Resolution
- UID: ed067e2b-7ed2-4ece-9dd1-f3cb61c83a02

- Topic: Appeal Hearing for Ms. Sharon Jasper
- Summary: Valerie D. Bouldin informed Ms. Sharon Jasper of her scheduled Appeal Hearing, but Ms. Jasper received additional notification from the mayor's office concerning her termination.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Ms. Sharon Jasper received additional notification from the mayor's office concerning her termination.
- Tags/Keywords: Appeal Hearing, Termination Notice, Mayor's Office
- UID: ed067e2b-7ed2-4ece-9dd1-f3cb61c83a02

- Topic: VCC Report on Appeal of Deferral
- Summary: The Director of the Vieux Carré Commission submitted a report regarding an appeal of the deferral of VCC's plan to construct multi-story additions at the property located at 440 Bourbon Street.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The Vieux Carré Commission submitted a report on the appeal of the deferral for the construction plan at 440 Bourbon Street.
- Tags/Keywords: Vieux Carré Commission, Appeal, Construction Plan
- UID: ed067e2b-7ed2-4ece-9dd1-f3cb61c83a02

- Topic: Report of the Deputy Director of the New Orleans Historic District Landmarks Commission
- Summary: The Deputy Director submitted a report concerning the Central Business District Historic District Landmarks Commission.
- Ordinance Number: N/A

- Topic: Appeal of HDLC Decision for 709 Touro Street
- Summary: Report regarding an appeal of the Historic District Landmarks Commission’s decision to deny the request for retention of shutter dog hardware and ornate metal handrails installed at the entry and allow the retention of the ornate metal gates installed at the left and right-side alleys with the proviso that the applicant must work with Staff on a strategy for reducing the ornamental infill as much as possible for the property located at 709 Touro Street.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Report submitted for consideration
- Tags/Keywords: HDLC, appeal, historic district, landmarks commission, 709 Touro Street
- UID: ccf04881-7fd3-4e3e-8c46-26cf1c1289ac

- Topic: Zoning Docket Numbers 88/22, 89/22, 90/22, 91/22, 92/22, Street Name Change, Downtown Development District 2023 Budget and Work Plan
- Summary: Transmitting various zoning docket numbers and a street name change, as well as the Downtown Development District 2023 Budget and Work Plan for consideration and approval.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Information submitted for consideration
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning docket, street name change, downtown development district, budget, work plan
- UID: ccf04881-7fd3-4e3e-8c46-26cf1c1289ac

- Topic: Amendment to Ordinance No. 16,753 MCS (Zoning Docket 120/94)
- Summary: An ordinance to grant an amendment to permit the retail sale of packaged alcoholic beverages in a specific commercial district.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,961
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Amendment to ordinance granted
- Tags/Keywords: Amendment, zoning docket, retail sale, alcoholic beverages
- UID: ccf04881-7fd3-4e3e-8c46-26cf1c1289ac

- Topic: Conditional Use for Hotel in CBD-5 Urban Core Neighborhood
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to establish a conditional use to permit a hotel in a specific district. It was introduced by Councilmember Harris. The ordinance was adopted with 6 YEAS and 0 NAYS.
- Ordinance Number: 33962
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopt - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted, allowing the conditional use for a hotel in the specified district.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Conditional Use, Hotel, Urban Core
- UID: 0e302067-c5d6-4af5-a7f6-fbf101260ac9

- Topic: Issuance of Series 2023 Revenue Bonds
- Summary: This ordinance authorized the issuance, sale, and delivery of Series 2023 Revenue Bonds for the New Orleans Aviation Board. It was introduced by Councilmember Green. The ordinance was adopted for the issuance of not to exceed Thirty-five Million Dollars ($35,000,000) of Series 2023 Revenue Bonds.
- Ordinance Number: R-22-506
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopt - (Information not provided)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted, allowing the issuance of the specified revenue bonds for the Aviation Board.
- Tags/Keywords: Revenue Bonds, Aviation Board, Financial Authorization
- UID: 0e302067-c5d6-4af5-a7f6-fbf101260ac9

- Topic: Repeal and Replacement of Rule 56 (Temporary COVID-19 Meeting Procedures)
- Summary: The ordinance aims to repeal and supersede the current Rule 56 with Rule 56 (Confirmation of Executive Branch Appointments).
- Ordinance Number: R-22-506
- Votes Summary:

- Topic: Reporting Requirements for Department of Finance
- Summary: The ordinance aims to establish reporting requirements for the Department of Finance, including the issuance of a statement for each payment the City of New Orleans provides to a security and improvement district, as well as an annual financial report to be transmitted to the City Council.

- Votes Summary:

- Summary: This ordinance seeks to amend and clarify sections of the Code of the City of New Orleans related to honorary street dedications.
